title: Building a Nation
subtle:
Historical (nonfiction), 2,196 words, Level Z1 (Grade 5+), Lexile 1050L            
                        
		Multilevel Book also available in levels                     Z and Z2
description: What happened after the thirteen colonies declared independence from Great Britain? Building a Nation is an informational book that is a continuation of Seeds of Revolution and Battling for Independence. The book can also be used to teach students how to analyze problem and solution and the proper use of compound adjectives. The book and lesson are also available for levels Z and Z2.
meta: authority, checks and balances, compromise, constitution, debates, debts, executive, expansion, guaranteed, judicial, legislative, prosperity, ratify, rebellion, representatives, seizing, treaty, tyranny
Use the reading strategy of asking and answering questions to understand text
Problem and Solution : Analyze the problem and solution in the story
Compound Adjectives : Identify and use compound adjectives
Prepositional Phrases : Understand the use of prepositional phrases within sentences

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
